result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonta Rashad Harmon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deonta Rashad Harmon in court, in custody.  Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court for Deonta Rashad Harmon.  Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court on Defendant's Motion to Suppress.  Court ordered sequestration of witnesses.  Sworn for the State: Chad Boyack (MPD Officer).  Court rescheduled hearing for reasons stated on the record.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress, filed

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a motion hearing date.  Court set date as requested.  State's response to the defense's motion is due 9-07-2022.  This matter will be held in person in room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Defense Motion to Suppress Evidence.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Deonta Rashad Harmon not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a hearing. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Brostrom.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40. Court orders the September 20th, 2022, motion hearing date VACATED. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Case is adjourned for hearing in Br 45.  mn
Defense request for Substitution of Judge, Filed.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court via zoom, defendant Deonta Rashad Harmon not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance waived.  At the request of defense counsel, this matter is adjourned for a Motion Hearing.  The Court set deadline of 8/22/22 for defense to file paperwork; the State has a deadline of 8/26/22 by the close of business to reply/respond.    Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  mn  Motion hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE KIES. 

Off record discussions held, defense requests adjournment. Case adjourned in Branch 45. Parties notified.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Deonta Rashad Harmon not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested an additional scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deonta Rashad Harmon in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Deonta Rashad Harmon in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deonta Rashad Harmon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of defendant's prior conviction dated 07/15/2019. Sworn for the State: P.O. Ryan Clementz - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Amount: $20.00

09:24 AM Defendant Deonta Rashad Harmon not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deonta Rashad Harmon in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Deonta Rashad Harmon in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deonta Rashad Harmon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
